name: Toy Story in Concert
description:
Making its Canadian debut, we are excited to present the animated classic on the big screen in its entirety, accompanied by a live orchestra performing composer Randy Newman's vibrant score note-for-note. The perfect way to experience the original ahead of next year's Toy Story 5! 

Featuring the FILMharmonique Orchestra, Canada's premier orchestra dedicated to film concerts. Conductor: Francis Choinière.

Presentation licenced by Disney Concerts.

name: Evening of Kirtan
description:
You are warmly invited to join us for an evening of interactive musical mantra meditation. Kirtan is a call-and-response form of meditation, utilizing ancient eastern mantras, traditional instruments and our very own voices.

This event is an opportunity to explore your sacred heart space through the power of music and mantras. The practice of kirtan can tap into deep states of consciousness but can also invoke exciting feelings of joy and energy.

name: error 404: WORK IN PROCESS
description: Join Scarborough Arts at their Annual Juried Exhibition as they question the vulnerability of being in process, about navigating surprising breakthroughs and unexpected moments of evolution. error 404: WORK IN PROCESS invites artists to reflect on their own artistic journeys and the very nature of process itself. This exhibition embraces the experiments that failed, the cringe-worthy reflections and the radical shifts between art styles. Celebrating both the bad and the transformed, the artists in this group show present their old(est) works beside their new(est), revealing that we are all works in process.

name: Morgan's Journey
description:
By Robert Morgan and David S. Craig, starring Morgan St. Onge!

Delighting children and their families around the world for nearly three decades. From the moment of her birth, we follow Morgan the Clown on a journey of discovery. We delight in the presents she receives, especially her last one, a wise sock puppet who becomes her companion. 

Encountering inevitable growing pains, Morgan learns a valuable and moving lesson about love and the true meaning of friendship. The play offers audiences a unique opportunity for active participation. Morgan's Journey, originally created by Robert Morgan and director David S. Craig, launched Roseneath Theatre in 1983.

name: Frosting and Fun Cookie Decorating
description:
Get into the holiday spirit with a hands-on, family-friendly activity that's as fun as it is delicious! 

Join us for a festive cookie decorating event, where kids can create their own edible masterpieces and make memories one cookie at a time.

A delightful afternoon of frosting, fun, and festive memories awaits!

name: TIS THE SZN Holiday Market

address.streetAddress: 938 Queen St W Toronto, ON M6J 1G8

description:
TIS THE SZN Holiday Market is Toronto's most festive shopping experience. Located in the heart of Queen West, TIS THE SZN celebrates community, creativity, and local entrepreneurship. This market brings together over 25 local small businesses, artisans, and creators each weekend with a fresh vendor lineup every time you visit.

With pet-friendly access, and a cozy atmosphere, it offers a unique space for Toronto shoppers to discover handmade gifts, vintage finds, and one-of-a-kind holiday treasures while supporting small businesses.

name: Holly Berry Fair
description:
Join us for this thrilling event and get into the holiday spirit!

Enjoy Santa's Workshop, deli lunches, baked goods, a silent auction and browse through our eco-friendly vendor booths, and peruse through rare and used books!

name: Maker Bean Holiday Maker Market 2025
description:
Back for the seventh year, proudly supporting local artisans! 

New this year, enjoy a drop-in holiday market and activity for kids and adults. Support our food drive for Oasis Dufferin Community Centre, with a chance to win a raffle basket with items generously donated by our vendors!

name: Toastr Holiday Ball
description:
The holiday are here, let's dress up and spend a beautiful and enchanting dance fest.

We are inexlicably delighted to welcome a very special guest on live keys and vocals to handle early mingles, RnB jams and maybe a Christmas song or two. They are groovy to the max and a truly special performer.

Equally inexplicably delighted to have DJ Kage join Sticky Cuts for the tomfoolery portion of the evening where they will play only the best 80s, house, dancehall, pop and bangers.

name: Chopin's Magic presented by Oscar Jiang
description:
International concert pianist, Oscar Y. Jiang, presents various works of Frédéric Chopin on a vintage Steinway grand piano in an intimate setting. 

The afternoon of music will included well-loved classics and hidden gems. 

Jiang, a graduate of Julliard School of Music and the New England Conservatory of Music, has appeared on stages in his native Australia, North America, Taiwan, UK, Poland and across South-East Asia, including venues such as Australia House in London, the Taichung National Theatre, Melbourne Recital Centre, and Boston's Jordan Hall and has received various awards in Australia and internationally. 

He has graced festivals including the International Piano Master Course in Radziejowice, Poland, Art of Piano in Banff, Canada, and was invited as a Gilmore Piano Festival Fellow in 2024.

name: Mass for the Endangered
description:
Featuring choral, instrumental, and orchestral works performed by celebrated musicians Louise Bessette (piano), Judy Loman (harp), and Erika Raum (violin), with Soundstreams Choir 21 and Ensemble Soundstreams conducted by David Fallis. 

The first half of the concert features several pieces from Olivier Messiaen's Catalogue d'oiseaux: L'alouette calandrelle, Le traquet rieur, Le courlis cendré); R. Murray Schafer's Wild Bird (originally premiered by this night's performing harpist, Judy Loman); Andrew Balfour's Gaze Upon the Trees; the Canadian premiere of Let them not say by Chris Hutchings; and Veni Creator Spiritus by Arvo Pärt.

The concert concludes with Mass for the Endangered by Sarah Kirkland Snider. Hailed by National Public Radio as "one of today's most compelling composers for the human voice," her piece is a poignant choral meditation on the fragility of our natural world.

name: Holiday Artisan Market
description:
Get ahead of the holiday rush and join us for a festive day of local shopping and community cheer! 

Explore a holiday market featuring a curated selection of handcrafted goods made with care by passionate local artisans. From beautifully crafted candles and unique jewelry to art prints, cozy crochet items, and creative t-shirts, there's something special for everyone on your list.

name: Santa Paws at the Kimpton Saint George hotel
description: Santa Paws at the Kimpton Saint George Hotel is back! Happening in the hotel's Living Room, all are invited to get into the howl-iday spirit with a special holiday pet photo-op with Santa Claus. This cozy event offers a warm, pet-friendly atmosphere for you and your beloved pup to celebrate the season together!

name: Mung Jai
description:
Evocative Instrumentals lead by chimes guitars, heavy bass and grooving drums. 

Inspired by film scores from Morricone to Carpenter, rock and roll, rocksteady and classic hip hop to bring you a soundtrack from a parallel cinematic timeline.

name: Paws and Claus: Pet Photo with Santa
description:
Include your furry friends in this year's holiday card!

Make it a holiday tradition. Smiles, wagging tails, and Santa's magic await. Spots are limited, book now!

name: KILLABEATMAKER
description:
With more than 18 years in the music industry, Hilder brando Osorno is a Colombian music producer, who combines Colombian  rhythms with Afrobeats, Amapiano and Cumbia. 

His knowledge of South American traditional Indigenous music has allowed him to produce and print electronic and global club music to suit a vast fan base. He shared a Latin Grammy nomination in 2014, as a Sound Engineer, with a project that also won an award from the Nickelodeon TV channel Don Tetto.

He is not only an accomplished DJ, but has also established a vibrant live band that performs globally to thousands of people all over Europe and the Americas. The show brings a grooving and mystical combination through an energetic performance with unique instruments from the motherland.

name: Isabel Bayrakdarian with Kevork Mourad: Ancestral Songs, Prayers, and Lullabies

location.name: Koerner Hall, Royal Conservatory of Music

description:
Isabel Bayrakdarian is renowned across opera houses and concert halls the world over for her strikingly multihued voice, presence, and style. 

She has been applauded for opera performances in Chicago, Dresden, London, Milan, New York, Paris, Salzburg, San Francisco, and Toronto, and is celebrated as well for her work in remoter operas of the repertory, such as Berlioz's Benvenuto Cellini and Bolcom's A View from the Bridge, in which she made her Metropolitan Opera debut.

She has sung on the Grammy Award-winning soundtrack of the blockbuster film The Lord of The Rings: The Two Towers, and her voice can also be heard in Atom Egoyan's multiple award-winning Canadian film Ararat.

Please join us! This concert is preceded by a short performance by talented students of The Royal Conservatory.

name: Made in Ontario Holiday Artisan Market
description:
Transforming the historic halls of the Legislative Building into a festive wonderland! Enjoy this non-partisan community event shines a spotlight on the province's creativity and craftsmanship, with a showcase of handmade goods from Ontario artisans.  

Whether you're searching for the perfect holiday gift or simply soaking in the scenes of the season, this one-day event promises a shopping experience brimming with warmth and charm. 

As you explore, delight in the festive decorations and treat yourself to refreshments from the Quorum Café.  

Please note that airport-style security screening will be in place to enter the building (government photo ID required for ages 16 and up).

name: Holiday Market Sip 'n' Shop at the Kimpton Saint George
description:
Celebrate the holidays, enjoy a glass of wine from The Hare, complimentary tea from DAVIDsTEA, light bites, and live music while shopping luxe local Toronto brands! Get ahead of your holiday shopping and find the perfect gift in a festive, pet-friendly environment. 

Plus, get into the howl-iday spirit with Santa Paws, a special photo-op with Santa Claus from 12 pm - 2 pm for you and your furry friend. The event is free, making it an ideal way to kick off your holiday shopping and spend time with friends—furry ones included!

name: Remembering Scarborough's GECO Girls: A Conversation with Barbara Dickson at Scarborough Museum
description:
This November, we remember Scarborough's very own GECO girls! Along with a pop-up panel highlighting these women, Scarborough Museum will be hosting a conversation with author and local historian, Barbara Dickson, as she discusses her book "Bomb Girls: Trading Aprons for Ammo" by the fireside, followed by a book signing. 

Challenging common gender narratives regarding war efforts, Dickson traces the lives of these women and their dangerous work at Canada's largest fuse filling munitions factory. Ranging in age from 17 to 70, they included newcomers from countries like Nigeria, Greece, China, and Syria. If you love what you learn, limited copies will be available for purchase.

As part of the Community Memories project the City of Toronto Collections and Archives team will be part of this event. If you have family photo you'd like to preserve, they will scan and digitize it for free!

Treats and refreshments will be available on a first come-first served basis, while quantities last.

name: The Arsenals
description:
Named after the English football club, Crash and James Morgan formed the band in 1992, and have played their blend of Jamaican music through the decades. 

They skillfully engage audiences with the styles of mento, ska, rocksteady and reggae music, consistently putting on a high energy show. This 6 piece band is lead by Trombonist Dizzy Minott and often features a surprise guest at their shows. 

They have opened for countless headline acts such as Ziggy Marley, Toots and the Maytals, Bounty Killa, Third World and many more.

name: Majd Sukar
description:
A Syrian-Canadian virtuoso clarinetist whose name has been distinguished in the Toronto music scene for his fusion music and unique sound. 

His style blends Middle Eastern folk and classical music with jazz music in unparalleled practice. Sukar brings his music to the Canadian music scene as a soloist and improviser. 

He performed with prominent musicians like Robi Botos, Drew Jurecka, Andrew Downing and the Indian indigenous singer Laura Grizzlypaws. What made his music noticeable in a short time is his hard work and passion which pushed him to join many Torontonian bands like Romani Jazz, Fethi Nadjem North African ensemble, Moneka Arabic Jazz, Moskitto bar and Spiral Modes. 

Moreover, Majd has appeared as a master improviser with Canadian Arabic Orchestra since 2016. He toured over 30 Canadian cities with them carrying his unique sound from his roots to the new world.

name: Toronto Beatlemania
description:
Calling Toronto Beatles fans!
 
Join us for our return for the third year in a row! 

Travel through time - From early Ed Sullivan to Let it Be, you'll get all the hits. Experience this live Beatles performance through all eras of their career, performed on stage by The Liverpool 4 with the same high energy, impeccable musicianship, showmanship, fun and humour.

The show performance is two acts with a 20-minute intermission. It must be experienced to be believed. Come together and sing and dance along, clap your hands, stomp your feet, or just rattle your jewelry!

name: David Francey
description:
Scottish-born Canadian carpenter turned songwriter, who known as "one of Canada's most revered folk poets and singers.

A truly authentic folk singer, Francey is a documentarian of the working person who never imagined earning a living from his music. When he was in his 40s, his wife, artist Beth Girdler, encouraged him to share his songs and sing in public. The reaction was instant. His first album "Torn Screen Door" came out in 1999 and was a hit in Canada. Since then, he has released 11 albums, won three JUNO Awards and has had his songs covered by such artists as The Del McCoury Band, The Rankin Family, James Keelaghan and Tracy Grammer.

In concert, David is a singer and a storyteller. Attend his long-waited return.

name: Crescent Town Club Craft Show and Sale
description: Find beautiful handmade and curated items that will make perfect gift or treat yourself!
